title: National Archives says it still doesn't have all Trump White House records
description: The National Archives has told the House Oversight Committee that certain presidential records from the Trump administration remain outstanding, citing information that some White House staff used non-official electronic systems to conduct official business.

title: Steps of a Russian Orthodox cathedral in New York were splashed with red paint
description: A Russian Orthodox cathedral in New York appears to have been defaced with red paint, following a similar incident in which the Russian consulate was vandalized with red spray paint.

title: Putin ally slams Russian generals after Lyman withdrawal, encourages 'using low-yield nuclear weapons'
American citizen held in Iran for more than six years released to seek medical treatment, UN spokesperson says
description: An elderly American wrongfully held in Iran for more than six years has been permitted to leave the country "to seek medical treatment abroad," according to a statement from UN Secretary General spokesperson Stéphane Dujarric.

title: Biden announces return of seven American detainees from Venezuela
description: President Joe Biden on Saturday announced the return of seven Americans he said were wrongfully detained in Venezuela for "years."

title: Man fatally slashed during dispute on New York City subway train
description: A 43-year-old man died Friday after being slashed on the neck during a dispute on a Brooklyn subway train, the New York Police Department said.

title: Stolen in 1917, this 1,000-year-old manuscript was just returned to its rightful owners
description: A 1,000-year-old manuscript looted during World War I has been returned to the Greek monastery from where it was stolen more than a century ago.

title: The Supreme Court's legitimacy is in danger
description: The power of the first branch of American government, Congress, comes from its ability to tax and spend, a formidable strength. The power of the president, the second branch, crucially includes his or her role as commander in chief of the armed forces. The power of the third branch, by contrast, is technically its symbolic authority.

title: Dramatic images show spacecraft collision with an asteroid
description: The DART mission made history this week when it successfully slammed into an asteroid -- and we got to see it happen live, from millions of miles away.

title: See rare clash between two humpbacks and group of orcas
description: Video captured by whale watchers shows a scuffle taking place in the Strait of Juan de Fuca, near Seattle and Vancouver, between two humpback whales and a group of orcas. CNN affiliate KING has the story.

title: The world's largest bobblehead unveiled at a bargain store in Pennsylvania
description: Bargain retailer Ollie's says it broke a world record on Wednesday -- with a 16.5 foot tall, 600-pound bobblehead replica of their mascot.

title: From intensive care to the F1 grid, Alex Albon's remarkable comeback
description: Formula One drivers are renowned for pushing their body and mind to the limits.

title: The staggering toll of this constant state of emergency
description: Across the world, mental health is having a moment, in large part courtesy of the Covid-19 pandemic. Never before have we focused so much on emotional well-being. Months of isolation, fear and remote schooling have changed how we define our health.

title: Firefly succesfully launches unmanned rocket
description: Texas-based commercial rocket company Firefly launched a rocket into space Friday morning, about a year after a previous attempt ended in an explosion.

title: Russia's claimed annexations could signal new phase of conflict
It'll cast a spell on you: Disney+ sequel 'Hocus Pocus 2' is magical
description: Why am I already seeing Thanksgiving decorations out and about?

title: Why 'Ring Nation' may be the most dystopian show on TV
description: Anyone watching the first episode of "Ring Nation" this week would have seen short clips of a man finding out his wife was pregnant with triplets, an uninvited iguana showing up at someone's front door and an unsuspecting teenage boy being chased down by a crane in his driveway.

title: A big week for Trump's delay delay delay legal strategy
description: While a lot of us have been diverted by weather events (Ian) and world events (Russia) there were multiple developments on multiple fronts where it concerns former President Donald Trump this week.

title: Ukraine encircles Russian forces near Donetsk, overshadowing Moscow's annexation of the region
description: Ukrainian forces are encircling Russian troops in Russian-occupied Lyman, in the Kramatorsk district of Donetsk, despite Moscow's annexation of the region that's been declared illegal by the West.

title: USA wins 11th world title at FIBA Women's Basketball World Cup
description: USA defended its title to win a 11th FIBA Women's Basketball World Cup after defeating China 83-61 in Sydney on Saturday.

title: Famed Japanese wrestler turned politician Antonio Inoki dies aged 79
description: Former Japanese professional wrestler Antonio Inoki has died aged 79, according to his organization.

title: Former President Jimmy Carter celebrates his 98th birthday
description: Jimmy Carter, the oldest living former US president, turns 98 on Saturday.

title: Amid global turmoil, superyachts are selling more than ever. Here's why
description: The world is in turmoil. The specter of global conflict lurks on the horizon. Energy prices are putting the squeeze on millions. Covid lingers. But in Monaco, at the yachting world's most glamorous event, it's business as usual.

title: How Spam became cool again
description: Spam is cool.

title: The world's most spectacular airport is about to double in size
description: This week in travel: The wreckage of the ship that tried to warn the Titanic about the iceberg has been found. The world's most spectacular airport is about to double in size. And the US has been bracing itself against Hurricane Ian.

title: San Francisco is renaming a street after man whose death shed light on the rise of anti-Asian hate
description: A street in San Francisco will now be renamed after a 84-year-old man whose death brought national attention to the rise of anti-Asian hate last year.

title: Long covid: What science has learned about the loss of smell and taste
description: Imagine waking up one morning after recovering from Covid-19 to find that your coffee smells like unwashed socks, your eggs reek of feces and your orange juice tastes metallic. Oddly, that's a good thing: It's a sign you still have a working sense of smell -- even if it's miswired in your brain.

title: 'Predatory,' widespread sexual harassment on Australia's Antarctic research bases, report finds
description: Australian women working on research bases in Antarctica have been plagued by a widespread culture of sexual harassment, a recently released report found.

title: California Gov. Gavin Newsom signs bill limiting the use of rap lyrics as evidence in criminal proceedings
description: California Gov. Gavin Newsom signed a bill into law on Friday that limits the use of rap lyrics in criminal court cases in the state.

title: Trump launches direct attack on McConnell a month out from midterm elections
description: Former President Donald Trump on Friday night directly ridiculed Senate Minority Leader Mitch McConnell, saying on his social media platform that the Kentucky Republican had a "death wish" for supporting "Democrat sponsored bills."

title: How digging up the past is helping US military veterans build a future
description: For many armed forces veterans, the return to civilian life can be a challenge. But one organization is taking an unusual approach to helping ex-service personnel find their feet -- involving them in archaeological projects to bring home the remains of fallen soldiers.

title: Tesla robot slowly walks on stage at AI Day
description: Tesla revealed on Friday a prototype of a humanoid robot that it says could be a future product for the automaker.

title: Abbott and O'Rourke clash over gun restrictions in lone Texas gubernatorial debate
description: Texas Republican Gov. Greg Abbott and Democratic challenger Beto O'Rourke clashed over gun restrictions in a debate Friday night, with O'Rourke claiming that Abbott blames "everybody else" for mass shootings while "misleading this state."

title: Listen to the terrifying call of a Florida woman trapped in floodwaters
description: CNN obtains a recorded phone call of a woman's struggle to survive Hurricane Ian. The storm surge flooded Hope Labriola's Fort Myers Beach's home before she was rescued. Take a listen.
